intro: Viola clementiana, commonly known as the Viola of Clement, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and vibrant violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained soil in partial shade. It blooms in spring and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. The flowers are usually borne on long, slender stems and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
